subject: Education
title: Levels of Processing: Shallow vs Deep
description: A quick win: understand Levels of Processing: Shallow vs Deep.

hook.text: You re-read the chapter five times but still failed the test. Why?

buildup.text: Re-reading processes words at a shallow, surface level‚Äîfont, sound, shape.

discovery.text: Craik and Lockhart showed that thinking about meaning encodes memories deeper.

twist.text: Even a single deep question beats ten passive re-reads for retention.

climax.text: Asking 'Why does this matter?' forces the brain into deep processing mode.

quiz.question: What makes deep processing more effective than re-reading?
options: It encodes meaning, creating stronger memory traces
It takes longer, so the brain tries harder
It uses visual memory instead of verbal
